natural solution: &= \frac{\sin^2 72^\circ}{8 \cos^2 18^\circ} \\ &= \boxed{\frac{1}{8}}. \end{align}Alternatively, we can plug in the value $\sin 18^\circ = \frac{\sqrt{5} - 1}{4}.$

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "x = 18 * pi / 180"
shows  "sin x powr 3 + sin x powr 2 = 1/8"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute $\sin^3 18^\circ + \sin^2 18^\circ.$ The final Answer is \frac{1}{8}
 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} \sin^3 18^\circ + \sin^2 18^\circ &= \sin^2 18^\circ (\sin 18^\circ + 1) \\ &= \sin^2 18^\circ (\sin 18^\circ + \sin 90^\circ). \end{align}By sum-to-product, \begin{align} \sin^2 18^\circ (\sin 18^\circ + \sin 90^\circ) &= \sin^2 18^\circ \cdot 2 \sin 54^\circ \cos 36^\circ \\
 &= 2 \sin^2 18^\circ \cos^2 36^\circ \\ &= \frac{2 \sin^2 18^\circ \cos^2 18^\circ \cos^2 36^\circ}{\cos^2 18^\circ} \\ &= \frac{4 \sin^2 18^\circ \cos^2 18^\circ \cos^2 36^\circ}{2 \cos^2 18^\circ}. \end{align}Then by double angle formula, \begin{align}
 \frac{4 \sin^2 18^\circ \cos^2 18^\circ \cos^2 36^\circ}{2 \cos^2 18^\circ} &= \frac{\sin^2 36^\circ \cos^2 36^\circ}{2 \cos^2 18^\circ} \\ &= \frac{4 \sin^2 36^\circ \cos^2 36^\circ}{8 \cos^2 18^\circ} \\
 &= \frac{\sin^2 72^\circ}{8 \cos^2 18^\circ} \\ &= \boxed{\frac{1}{8}}. \end{align}Alternatively, we can plug in the value $\sin 18^\circ = \frac{\sqrt{5} - 1}{4}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "x = 18 * pi / 180"
shows  "sin x powr 3 + sin x powr 2 = 1/8"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer

(* ### Problem

 *)
